Posts.Content: Apr 10, 2009 11:46AM - edited Apr 10, 2009 11:50AM by Gran2Angels tobikeyes, I'm sorry you are having to face this worry.  I just wanted to encourage you that what idaho stated regarding 80% of these being benign.  I went through this exact scenerio last year, birads 4b. The radiologists also told me that my situation did not look good, as she was trying to prepare me for the worst, I think to be sure I that I did follow up with a biopsy.  My results were benign.  I have follow up mammo's every 6 months and so far no problems.  I'm editing this to also say: I know the waiting is awful.  Reading here was great for me. The information and caring posts were just what I needed to feel informed and ready to face the challenge, should there be one.... Be encouraged!  Blessings, Gran

Posts.Content: Apr 1, 2008 06:22PM - edited Apr 1, 2008 06:33PM by Gran2Angels mariafromjersey,  - I'm in the south, so not your state, which could make a difference - but I wanted to tell you that our experience with the Aetna medicare plans has been very good.  Most of the physician offices/groups in our area are providers in the Aetna Medicare plans.  The provisions are much the same and you should have flexibility in provider/facility choices - what I would do is call a representative with a list of your existing providers/facilities and see if they are covered.  You can also check in advance for any of the places where you might want to seek treatment in the future. The customer service should be there to help you. Be sure and ask about online inquiries which are most helpful -  Some of these plans have everything online where you can check coverage and allowables or other special provisions.  Be encouraged - I hope this turns out to be a good plan for you.
